title: Boy, 2, dies after being trapped down 85ft well for three days

A toddler has died after becoming trapped down a 85ft deep well for three days.

Two-year-old Sujith Wilson fell down the abandoned shaft on Saturday evening while he played with his cousins in the state of Tamil Nadu, India.

The youngster was initially stuck 30 feet below the surface but he later slid deeper into the well.

Around 500 people took part in a rescue operation which saw a small camera being lowered into the hole to check on the tot's condition.

Workers from fire services, national and state disaster management agencies and the police pumped oxygen into the pit.

Thermal imaging cameras had detected heat as rescuers drilled a shaft parallel to the well.

(Image: TNIE Videos)

(Image: TNIE Videos)

Their efforts to rescue Sujith were hampered by the weather and the rocky soil and on Tuesday morning rescuers began to smell what turned out to be the boy's decomposing body.

J Radhakrishnan, principal secretary in the Transport Department and the relief commissioner, told India's NDTV: "We tried our best to rescue him but unfortunately foul smell has started coming from the bore well in which the child had fallen.

"The digging process has been stopped."

Sujith's body was recovered using "specialist equipment" and his funeral too place several hours later.

Hundreds of mourners attended his burial at a local cemetery.

Sujith's death has led to calls that punishments should be tougher for leaving wells open in India.

In June a toddler died in Punjab after falling down a well despite a two-day rescue mission to save him.
description: Around 500 people took part in a rescue operation to save two-year-old Sujith Wilson in Tamil Nadu, India
